Councilman -- District  1, City of Morgan City
Library Bond-NOT PW -- $2,500,000 Library Bond - PC - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Library Bond Proposition

Summary:  Authority to issue $2,500,000 of 20 year general obligation bonds of the Parish, excluding the City of Morgan City, Louisiana, for constructing, acquiring and improving public library buildings in said area of the Parish, and acquiring the necessary equipment, library books and furnishings therefor, with the proceeds of said bonds to be dedicated and used first to pay the cost of renovating and improving the Berwick branch and the headquarters building in Franklin; title to which shall be in the public, which bonds will be general obligations of the Parish, excluding the City of Morgan City, Louisiana, and will be payable from ad valorem taxes.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of St. Mary, State of Louisiana, incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of Two Million Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($2,500,000) to run twenty (20) years from the date thereof, with interest at rate not exceeding seven per centum (7%) per annum, for the purpose of constructing, acquiring and improving public library buildings in the Parish, outside the corporate limits of the City of Morgan City, Louisiana, and acquiring the necessary equipment, library books and furnishings therefor, with the proceeds of said bonds to be dedicated and used first to pay the cost of renovating and improving the Berwick branch and the headquarters building in Franklin; title to which shall be in the public, which bonds will be general obligations of the Parish, excluding the City of Morgan City, Louisiana, and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the Parish, excluding the City of Morgan City, Louisiana, in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and statutory authority supplemental thereto?

Race.SpecificTitle: Wax Lake East Drn. Dist. -- 2 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Wax Lake East Drainage District Proposition
(Tax Renewal)

Summary:  10 year, 2 mills property tax renewal for constructing, improving, maintaining and operating the drainage facilities in the District.
Race.FullText: Shall Wax Lake East Drainage District of the Parish of St. Mary, Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to continue to levy a two (2) mills tax (the estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the tax for one entire year being $153,218) on all the property subject to taxation in the District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of constructing, improving, maintaining and operating the drainage facilities in the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Gravity Drainage Dist.#6 -- 7.83 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Gravity Drainage District No. 6 Proposition
(Tax Continuation)

Summary:  10 year, 7.83 mills property tax continuation for acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating gravity and forced drainage works within and for the District.
Race.FullText: Shall Gravity Drainage District No. 6 of the Parish of St. Mary, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to continue to levy a seven and eighty-three hundredths (7.83) mills tax (the estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the tax for one entire year being $294,752) on all the property subject to taxation in the District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2008 and ending with the year 2017, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating gravity and forced drainage works within and for the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Cons. Gravity D.D. No.2 -- 5 Mills-BOC- 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Consolidated Gravity Drainage District No. 2 Proposition 
(Tax Continuation)

Summary:  10 year, 5 mills property tax continuation for acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating gravity and forced drainage works within and for Consolidated Gravity Drainage District No. 2.
Race.FullText: Shall Consolidated Gravity Drainage District No. 2 of the Parish of St. Mary, State of Louisiana (the "District") be authorized to continue to levy a tax of five (5) mills (the estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the tax for one entire year being $408,055) on all the property subject to taxation in the District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2008 and ending with the year 2017, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating gravity and forced drainage works within and for the District?
